title: The Last Bite of Bitterroot
premise: When the reclusive, sourdough-obsessed baker of a quaint mountain town is found dead in his own starter, disgraced food critic Elara Finch discovers his final, unsent newsletter contained a coded recipe—one that implicates half the town's pillars in a decades-old cover-up. To clear her own name and solve the murder, she must follow the culinary clues, baking her way through his cryptic legacy, but each perfected loaf seems to trigger another dangerous secret from the town's past.
protagonist: Elara Finch, a former celebrity food critic whose career was ruined by a fraudulent review scandal, now hiding out and writing a anonymous culinary blog.
conflict: Elara must decipher the baker's culinary code to find a killer before she becomes the next victim, all while navigating the mistrust of a community that wants its secrets to stay buried and confronting the person who sabotaged her own career.
setting: Present-day Bitterroot, a picturesque but isolated seasonal town in the Pacific Northwest, reliant on its charming bakery and annual 'Sourdough Summit' festival.
tone: Atmospheric and suspenseful with a warm, tactile culinary core; a blend of cozy mystery and simmering, small-town Gothic tension.
